item.title: God of War Trilogy Remake Features ‘New Fighting System’
item.content:encoded:
God of War Ragnarok’s Kratos actor has shared some new details on the upcoming Trilogy Remake.

For those unaware, Sony’s PlayStation State of Play event brought two new announcements for God of War fans: the confirmation of the original Trilogy Remake and a shadow drop for the 2D prequel title, Sons of Sparta. Now, new information about the trilogy remake has been revealed.

God of War Trilogy Remake to Include New Technology and Fighting System

Spotted in a video posted by RebsGaming on X (formerly Twitter), YouTuber Fuzhpuzy had the opportunity to meet Kratos actor, Christopher Judge, and ask him about the God of War Trilogy Remake. The YouTuber first asks whether Judge will be part of the remake, to which the actor replies, ‘No,’ and adds that it will include TC Carson, the original voice actor for Kratos from the Greek trilogy.

Judge elaborated that God of War Trilogy Remake is not a reboot and will feature “new technology” and a “new fighting system”. No details were revealed on what this new system would include or how it would change the previous one. Previously, we had only received confirmation that the trilogy remake is in development and were told it would be a long time before we received another update. The announcement also came through TC Carson, who confirmed that he will be voicing Kratos in the remake.

In other news, Christopher Judge has also stated that a new Santa Monica announcement is coming late summer. Additionally, God of War: Sons of Sparta has received harsh criticism from the OG series’ creator. What are your thoughts on God of War Remake Trilogy featuring a new fighting system? Leave your thoughts down in the comments, and join the official Insider Gaming Discord server.

For more information from Insider Gaming, read about Pokémon TCG Pocket teasing Gen 9 as the focus of the next set. Don’t forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.

item.title: God of War Actor Says New Santa Monica Announcement Will Arrive ‘Late Summer’
item.content:encoded:
The actor who played Kratos in God of War 2018 has revealed some details about the trilogy remake and the next Santa Monica announcement.

God of War has been in the news a lot recently, and that’s all thanks to PlayStation’s latest State of Play event, which dropped not but two announcements. There were already reports that Santa Monica was developing another title alongside the God of War Trilogy Remake, and now we have some more concrete information.

Spotted by RebsGaming on X (formerly Twitter), YouTuber Fuzhpuzy is seen talking to God of War 2018’s Kratos actor, Christopher Judge, at some fan expo. During their conversation, Judge talks about TC Carson playing Kratos in the trilogy remake before talking about what’s next. Judge states, “You’ll be hearing about what we’re doing probably late summer,” which hints at another announcement from Santa Monica. The video is currently unavailable on the YouTuber’s channel.

This is not the first time we have heard about Santa Monica’s other game. In addition to the previous report, insider NateTheHate has also stated that he has heard the Cory Barlog game will be “shown this year and then released in 2027”. However, one thing is unclear: whether this is the God of War Egypt game or some other IP altogether. Players will have to wait for an official announcement to know for sure.

In other news, God of War: Sons of Sparta is the worst-rated game in the series. Additionally, the 2018 title and Ragnarok have generated over $1 billion in sales combined. What are your thoughts on the Santa Monica announcement arriving this summer? Leave your thoughts down in the comments, and join the official Insider Gaming Discord server.

For more information from Insider Gaming, read about Fortnite reportedly collaborating with Game of Thrones soon. Don’t forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.

item.title: Fortnite And Game of Thrones Crossover Coming Soon, It’s Claimed
item.content:encoded:
Fortnite is seemingly going to collab with one of the most popular live-action series out there, Game of Thrones.

Collabs are something Fortnite is known for, and the developers have been cooking up some really cool ones lately. Some of the biggest ones we have seen lately are with The Simpsons, South Park, Kill Bill, Back to the Future, and more. Now, it seems that Epic might have even more in store for us.

Fortnite x Game of Thrones is in Development

The news about the Game of Thrones and Fortnite collab comes from AdiraFNInfo on X (formerly Twitter) and has been corroborated by reliable leaker, HYPEX. The collaboration is expected to arrive “soon,” but the contents and scope of this crossover were not revealed.

Game of Thrones is a fantasy drama series by HBO, an adaptation of George R. R. Martin’s novel. It received widespread critical acclaim and spawned spinoffs such as House of the Dragon, A Knight of the Seven Kingdoms, and more.

Some of the most popular characters from the series include Jon Snow (played by Kit Harrington), Arya Stark (played by Maisie Williams), Daenerys Targaryen (played by Emilia Clarke), Tyrion Lannister (played by Peter Dinklage), and more. Players would also love to see the Dragons come to Fortnite as a part of this collaboration.

A lot of rumoured Fortnite collaborations have surfaced recently. We have been informed of crossovers with franchises such as Kingdom Hearts, Vampire Diaries, Minecraft, and others; however, none have been officially revealed yet. Some of the leaks that have been accurately revealed recently include The Office and Overwatch.

What are your thoughts on Fortnite getting a Game of Thrones crossover? Leave your thoughts down in the comments, and join the official Insider Gaming Discord server.

For more information from Insider Gaming, read about Pokémon TCG Pocket teasing Gen 9 as the focus of the next set. Don’t forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.

item.title: Complete Resident Evil Requiem Trophy List—How To Get All Achievements & Trophies
item.content:encoded:
Resident Evil Requiem players will have plenty to do to fully complete the game, with a long list of achievements and trophies waiting to be ticked off.

The Capcom hit is one of the most anticipated titles of the year, with fans eagerly awaiting the latest entry in the franchise, and Resident Evil Requiem has plenty to offer.

If you’re on the hunt for every achievement and trophy available in Resident Evil Requiem, Insider Gaming has you covered.

All Resident Evil Requiem Trophies & Achievements

Resident Evil Requiem has a long list of trophies and achievements for completionists to churn through, some of which will require careful steps.

By far the most challenging of the trophies is completing the entirety of the main story in under four hours, as well as completing the game on Insanity difficulty. For the rest, it all comes down to progression and exploration, with multiple playthroughs likely to be required.

The trophies and achievements shown below may include some that are hidden and secret, so this is your warning that spoilers may lie ahead.

  • More Insider Gaming: When Is The Resident Evil Requiem Review Embargo Date? Resident Evil 9 Review Countdown

How Many Achievements & Trophies in Resident Evil Requiem?

There are 49 achievements and trophies to collect in Resident Evil Requiem, including the coveted Platinum trophy on PlayStation 5.

While many of the achievements and trophies can be earned naturally through progression, others require specific attention. Additionally, it will more than likely require extra playthroughs to tick off every task on the list.

In terms of collectables, there’s plenty to find too, including all Mr. Raccoon memoriams, all BSAA containers, and every safe in the main story.

Is Resident Evil Requiem going to be a Game of the Year contender? Share your thoughts in the Insider Gaming Discord.

For more Resident Evil Requiem, find out whether the game has early access, and check out how long it takes to complete the game.

item.title: All Resident Evil Requiem Spoilers—Resident Evil 9 Ending Spoilers & More
item.content:encoded:
Resident Evil Requiem is right around the corner, and there is a great demand for spoilers for the main story, so Insider Gaming can whet your appetite.

Releasing on February 27, Resident Evil Requiem is the ninth mainline entry in the beloved series, putting players in control of Grace Ashcroft and Leon Kennedy.

Anticipation is high for Resident Evil Requiem, but while some players are frantically trying to avoid every spoiler they can, others are actively seeking them out. If you’ve stumbled across this article, you’re probably in the latter group.

Warning: This article contains a wealth of spoilers for Resident Evil Requiem. If you don’t want spoilers for the main story and the ending, check out some of the other articles you can read on Insider Gaming.

Big Resident Evil Requiem Spoilers

This is the final warning before a slew of Resident Evil Requiem spoilers, so this is your last chance to look away!

Alyssa Ashcroft’s fate is cleared up with a full death scene, showing she has been killed by Victor Gideon. As shown in the trailers, he is the main villain of the story, alongside Zeno, who is a clone of Wesker.

The set-up for future games is significant, however, as Spencer makes a return. It’s revealed that Grace is actually Spencer’s daughter. While not officially stated that Alyssa was forced to adopt Grace, it’s implied, and Alyssa was put in charge of Grace’s care after his death.

Despite Spencer’s previous death, it’s made clear he was pulling the strings throughout Requiem, and the release of the cure to the virus was all part of his masterplan.

For completionists, there are two unlockable outfits, one for each character, and 12 unlockable weapons to find.

The majority of the major leaks come from Dusk Golem on the ResetEra forums.

Resident Evil 9 Ending Spoilers, Explained

Resident Evil 9 has two possible endings, based on your approach in-game, with a ‘good’ ending, which is canon, and a non-canon ‘bad’ ending.

In the good ending, Elpis, a cure for the infection, is released, resulting in both Grace and Leon surviving. The bad ending, where Elpis is destroyed, leads to Leon’s death.

Crucially, the good ending that cures Leon of his infection leads to him de-ageing and becoming younger, following in the footsteps of Jill. In this ending, Victor Gideon kills Zeno, preventing him from killing Leon.

In the bad ending, Gideon doesn’t appear at the end, and Zeno explodes Leon’s head. However, he also dies as the platform where they are standing collapses.

As mentioned, the ‘bad’ ending with Leon’s death is not Capcom‘s ‘canon’ ending, and thus leaves the door open for the character to return in future.

For more Resident Evil Requiem content, find out how long it takes to beat the game, and check out details of the review embargo date.

item.title: Pokémon TCG Pocket Teases Focus of Next Set
item.content:encoded:
A new post teases a focus on Generation 9 for Pokémon TCG Pocket’s next set.

We learned something about Pokémon TCG Pocket recently, with the devs confirming to Insider Gaming that there are no immediate plans for it to become a competitive game and that it will remain a side event at tournaments. Sticking to their guns, the developers have now teased the next set for the title.

Pokémon TCG Pocket’s Next Set May Focus on Gen 9

The official X account (formerly Twitter) of Pokémon TCG Pocket has posted a new video teasing Gen 9 for the next set. The video features people in costumes of the Gen 9 starters, including Sprigatito, Fuecoco, and Quaxly. Towards the end of the video, we are flashed with a date and time, February 19, 14:00 UTC. Many players in the comments section are theorising what this tease could be, while others are asking for other upgrades and features.

Gen 9 Pokémon are primarily found in the Paldea Region, which was introduced in Scarlet and Violet. TCG Pocket currently features some Gen 9 Pokémon with a line for Sprigatito. However, we are yet to receive the Fuecoco and Quaxly lines. Players will have to wait for the official announcement to know for sure what this tease means for the game.

In other news, here are six things Insider Gaming learned from attending Pokémon EUIC 2026 in London. Additionally, here’s a hands-on preview of Pokopia, a life-simulation spin-off title for the Pokémon franchise. What are your thoughts on Pokémon TCG Pocket’s tease for the next set? Leave your thoughts down in the comments, and join the official Insider Gaming Discord server.

For more information from Insider Gaming, read about Destiny 2’s next major update, Shadow and Order, being delayed until June 2026. Don’t forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.

item.title: NYT Mini Crossword Hints Today—Answers For Thursday, February 19
item.content:encoded:
The NYT Mini Crossword is a popular, quick-to-complete word game to test yourself daily, but some of the puzzles can be difficult to complete.

If you’ve found yourself stuck on today’s NYT Mini, Insider Gaming has some helpful hints and all the answers for the NYT Mini Crossword on February 19, 2026.

IMPORTANT: The following information includes spoilers on today’s edition of the NYT Mini Crossword. If you don’t want the answer given to you, stop scrolling.

How to Play NYT Mini Crossword

The NYT Mini Crossword is available to play on the New York Times Games app or website, but, as of September 2025, a New York Times Game subscription is required.

The NYT Games Subscription is priced at $6.95 per month, but there are introductory offers available for other NYT subscriptions that include games access, which might be worth considering.

Without a Games subscription, access to the NYT Mini Crossword is blocked.

NYT Mini Crossword Clues (Feb. 19)

Here are all the tips provided for the NYT Mini Crossword for February 19, 2026.

Across

1 – With 5-Across, response to “Knock, knock!”

5 – See 1-Across

6 – Dating app alternative to Tinder or Bumble.

7 – Take the top off, as a tube of toothpaste.

8 – [This person has read your message.]

Down

1 – Say “But, Mom!,” say.

2 – As a result.

3 – Something that a medical donor gives or a church has.

4 – Flow slowly.

5 – As a result.

Additional Clues For NYT Mini (Feb. 19)

Here are some additional clues to help you solve the NYT Mini on February 19, 2026.

Across

1 – “___ afraid of little old me?”

5 – “Look over ____”

6 – A crucial part of a door.

7 – Remove a lid or cover from a container.

8 – “Sold as ___”

Down

1 – Childish complaint.

2 – “For this reason.”

3 – Like a heart, or lungs.

4 – Gradual ooze.

5 – “In this way.”

All NYT Mini Crossword Answers (Feb. 19)

If you’re still unable to crack the code, here are all the answers for the NYT Mini on February 19, 2026.

Across

1 – WHOS

5 – THERE

6 – HINGE

7 – UNCAP

8 – SEEN

Down

1 – WHINE

2 – HENCE

3 – ORGAN

4 – SEEP

5 – THUS

When is The Next Game?

The NYT Mini Crossword refreshes daily at 10 PM ET on weekdays and Saturdays, and at 6 PM ET on Sundays.

As such, the next NYT Mini Crossword will be available at 7 PM PT/9 PM CT/10 PM ET/3 AM GMT/2 PM AET.

What is The NYT Mini Crossword?

The NYT Mini Crossword was introduced in 2014 as a shorter and quicker-to-complete game to accompany the main New York Times Crossword, which was initially released in 1942.

Until September 2025, the NYT Mini Crossword was free, but it has now been consolidated into a monthly NYT Games Subscription alongside several other popular games.

Did you struggle with the NYT Mini Crossword today? Share your thoughts in the Insider Gaming Discord.

For more word games, check out hints and answers for today’s Contexto, and take a look at hints for today’s NYT Strands.
